page.title: 13COMMUNITY
page.content: {RELIGION}still plays a part in Kingscote. 39%of respondents claim to use the church and the lack of a resident vicar is regretted. 35% use the village pub and the post office and 26% the village hall. 16% use none of these facilities. The only other amenity is a mobile library. The village lacks amenities that town dwellers take for granted such as newspapers and milk delivery, mains gas and drainage, adequate street lights, a school or childrens playground. However more people(31%) regret the lack of a village shop than all of these put together.{CLUBS}in the village include WI, Altar Guild,Sunday School, Playgroup,Toddler Group. There is a parish council and a village hall committee. Barn Dances, Carol Singing, talks and a Fun Day were organized for{RECREATION.
